questionListItems.title: Can food be brought into the parade during ndp preview?

answer.body: Light snacks and water are provided in the NDP Pack. You can bring food and bottled drink if required. Please be reminded to refrain from bringing large bag for the event.  Kindly refer to our website at https://www.ndp.gov.sg/ or follow us on Facebook, Instagram and TikTok (@NDPeeps) for more information. Once again, we thank you for your interest in NDP 2023.

questionListItems.title: How can I apply for NDP 2023 tickets?

answer.body:
To apply for tickets, you can access and submit the application form starting from 12:00pm on 29 May 2023 until 12:00pm on 12 June 2023.
Click here to apply.
Please note that once the application window closes, no further applications will be accepted.

questionListItems.title: Where is the ticket collection at?

answer.body:
The ticket collection will be at Suntec City, Atrium (Tower 1 & 2) (7 Temasek Blvd, Singapore 038987). The nearest MRT stations are City Hall (NS25 / EW13), Promenade (CC4 / DT15), and Esplanade (CC3). Successful applicants may collect the tickets between 10:30 am (GMT+8) to 8:30 pm (GMT+8) on any of the following dates:

 

  • 30 Jun to 2 July 2023 (Friday, Saturday, Sunday)

  • 7 to 9 July 2023 (Friday, Saturday, Sunday)

questionListItems.title: What is the Theme for NDP 2023?

answer.body: This year’s theme is “Onward As One”, which calls upon Singaporeans to look forward confidently and move onward together in building our shared future as one united people. “Onward” reflects a nation that is forward looking and resilient to any challenges that lie ahead. “As One” underscores the collective ownership of Singapore’s future, and the importance of inclusivity and unity.

questionListItems.title: I’m wheelchair-bound, is the parade wheelchair accessible?

answer.body: The National Day Parade is inclusive and we have made provisions for wheelchair-bound individuals to join us in the celebrations

questionListItems.title: When will the balloting results be announced?

answer.body: The ballot results will be released through email notification from 23 to 28 June 2023. Kindly be informed that only successful applicants will be notified.

questionListItems.title: What is the minimum age to ballot for NDP Tickets?

answer.body: Singapore Citizens and Permanent Residents of all ages are eligible to apply for tickets.

questionListItems.title: Can my infant child attend NDP and does she need a ticket?

answer.body: Children, including infants, are allowed to attend the National Day Parade (NDP). Everyone will require a ticket for entry, regardless of age.

questionListItems.title: What is the Logo for NDP 2023?

answer.body: This year’s logo portrays Singapore’s determination to come together to build a shared future. The lion head looking forward confidently and resolutely beyond the curve, which symbolises the horizon, represents our nation coming together with the determination to build a shared future. The number “58” embedded in the lion’s head reminds us of how far we have come in the past 58 years. The five stars represent the nation’s ideals of democracy, peace, progress, justice and equality. These ideals will firmly anchor Singaporeans as we move onward as one. The logo is also facing upward to represent the aspirations of Singaporeans to take Singapore to greater heights, amidst any challenges that may lie ahead.

questionListItems.title: Can I bring a non-citizen/non-PR to attend NDP?

answer.body: Anyone who attend NDP must have a ticket. You can bring your friends or loved ones with you as long as they have a ticket.

questionListItems.title: I missed the ticket application window. Can I still apply for tickets? Can the application window be extended?

answer.body: The ticket application window is strictly from 12:00pm on 29 May 2023 to 12:00pm on 12 June 2023. We regret to inform you that we are unable to extend the window or accept any appeals.

questionListItems.title: What is the Theme Song for NDP 2023?

answer.body: This year’s theme song is titled “Shine Your Light”. You can learn more about the theme song for NDP 2023 at www.ndp.gov.sg/about/theme-song.

questionListItems.title: Where are the locations of the Heartland Celebrations?

answer.body:
On 5 and 6 August, Singaporeans can visit five carnival sites from 4.00pm to 9.00pm. The five sites are as follows: 

a. ActiveSG Bedok Sport Centre 
b. ActiveSG Jurong West Sport Centre 
c. ActiveSG Toa Payoh Sport Centre 
d. ActiveSG Woodlands Sport Centre 
e. Our Tampines Hub

As the seats at the Padang are not sheltered, show attendees are advised to dress appropriately for the outdoors. We encourage you to wear red and white to celebrate our nation's birthday! For more information, please refer to the Admission Advisory provided here.

questionListItems.title: What time will the gates be open for entry into the Padang?

answer.body: The gates will open at 4:00pm, and we encourage you to arrive early as there will be multiple checkpoints to clear. During peak periods, please anticipate up to 60-minute wait for entry. For more information, please refer to the Admission Advisory provided here.
